placeDesc: Founded in 1891 by Artur Hazelius, Swedish scholar and folklorist, Skansen was the first open air museum in Sweden, intended to display pre-industrial life around Sweden through historic structures. Many of the traditional buildings and homes at Skansen were moved from other parts of the country, with a few detailed replicas mixed in.
placeShortDesc: Sweden's "good old days" painstakingly re-created in a model village.
placeRelatedPlaces: ['The Disney Collection', 'Best Video Film & Cultural Center', 'Rocky Mountain Quilt Museum', 'Curioporium']
